b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:59): can rdf:RDF legitimately have non-xmlns attributes?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:00): Hixie: should only rdf:RDF be allowed as an RDF subtree root or should rdf:Description be allowed as well?
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:01): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: ie doesn't know about HTMLOListElement
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:02): 496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96: ok. what test would you suggest instead?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:02): I have a hard time interpreting http://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-syntax-grammar/#start
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:03): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: .tagName.toLowerCase() == "ol"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:03): 496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96: not theoretically pure, but OK
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:04): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: indeed. not sure what else would work cross-browser
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:05): 496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96: does IE support nodeName? it would be more robust in case I ever put whitespace there
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:06): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: it does
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:06): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: you could check .start
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:06): returns 1 if <ol> otherwise undefined
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:07): http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/?%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%0D%0A%3Col%3E.%3Cscript%3Ew(document.body.firstChild.start)%3C%2Fscript%3E
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:07): hmm. I'm not sure which test is theoretically less pure...
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:08): firefox returns -1 though
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:10): 496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96: yeah, I just noticed it broke firefox
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:10): but -1 is truthy so you could just do if (n.start)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:10): I did if (n.start) and it broke
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:12): weird
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:12): hmm. file copying was what broke
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:12): ok
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:12): now the script is on the server for real
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:12): 496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96: thanks
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:13): np
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:13): XHTML in Safari still broken

496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:14): hmm, now ie7 crashes
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:21): 496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96: any advice on what I need to do to stop it from crashing?
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:21): i don't know what it is that makes it crash
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:22): it's not the .start check, i think
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:23): I think I'm doing relatively tame DOM operations
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:23): it's not createHtmlElement either
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:26): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: you may need to set .type = 'button' before you append the input to the p

496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:27): a%20%3D%20createHtmlElement('p')%0D%0A%09var%20button%20%3D%20createHtmlElement('input')%0D%0A%09para.appendChild(button)%0D%0A%09button.type%20%3D%20'button'%0D%0A%7D%0D%0AinstallGroupingToggle()%0D%0A%3C%2Fscript%3E

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:30): 496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96: you were right about document.body and Safari
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:36): has no idea what makes ie crash :(
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:37): 496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96: does it crash onload?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:37): that is, before pushing the button?
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:37): yes
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:37): but not before you've validated something
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:38): i.e. just loading http://validator.nu/ works fine
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:38): well, crashing isn't user-friendly
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:38): I guess it's better if I just disable the script for IE
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:39): I wonder what's the best way to *really* detect IE without depriving other browsers of the script
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:39): should I just put the instanceof thing back?
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:40): that would work
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (17:40): the safest way otherwise, i think, is conditional comments (either in html or js)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:43): 496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96: I put instanceof back
